newsitem.title: USA: Pamela Anderson Lee describes movie sex scenes.
newsitem.headline: Pamela Anderson Lee describes movie sex scenes.

text.p: Former "Baywatch" TV star Pamela Anderson Lee, sued for backing out of a movie deal, told a court on Thursday about the simulated sex scenes she had objected to in the film.
Reading from the script for "Hello, She Lied," Lee quoted stage directions for four specific scenes, including "he reaches under her dress; they make passionate love," and "he kisses her breast."
Lee, called to the stand by her defence lawyer, contends she withdrew from the film project because of objectionable graphic sex scenes.
Cross-examined by plaintiffs' lawyer Robert Wolfe, Lee stated emphatically: "You will never see me in another simulated sex scene for the rest of my life.
"I don't want to be touched by people I don't know," she said. "If I had gone to Florida (to shoot the film) they would have made me do simulated sex -- I know that, I'm not stupid."
When Wolfe pressed her about on-screen lovemaking and simulated sex, Lee became exasperated. "I don't even know what you're asking me ... Ask me a real question," she snapped.
Judge David Horowitz adjourned the session for a lunch break before Wolfe could continue.

Lee is being sued for $5 million by The Private Movie Co., which alleges she broke an agreement to star in "Hello, She Lied" because she was offered $500,000 to make the feature film "Barb Wire," which was a box-office flop.
The Canadian-born actress, married to rock drummer Tommy Lee of the band Motley Crue, claimed she changed her mind about making "Hello, She Lied" after seeing the script.
In testimony last week, she told the court that although she was not opposed to nudity, she did object to graphic sex scenes in "Hello, She Lied."
Even when a proposed naked shower scene was rewritten because of her complaints, she said, it was replaced with a scene in which her character was to have sex on a pool table.
"Hello, She Lied" was later made as "Miami Hustler" with model Kathy Ireland in the lead role for the Showtime cable TV channel. Ireland had a "no-nudity" clause in her contract.
